PLAYWRIGHT.Definition: someone who writes plays (a work written to be performed on stage)

WIT.Definition: someone who can express himself in a clever and humorous way

CULMINATING.Definition: reaching its highest point or degree

IMPRISONMENT.Definition: the state of being kept in prison or captivity

TALK OF THE TOWN.Definition: being the centre of attention or the person that many people talk about

JOURNALS.Definition: magazines that present articles on a particular subject

PEN NAME.Definition: a name chosen by a writer to use instead of his real name when publishing books

WITTY.Definition: being able to express themselves in a clever and funny way

SCHOLARSHIP.Definition: payment made to support his education which was given to him as a reward

FLAMBOYANT.Definition: showing confidence and meant to attract attention

REPRESSION.Definition: an act or process which limits freedom

REPRESSED.Definition: having limited freedom or ways of expression

AESTHETICISM.Definition: an artistic and intellectual movement which put a focus on beauty

NORMS.Definition: accepted ideas or standards of behaviour

UNORTHODOX.Definition: different from what was usually expected

BURSTING.Definition: going or entering suddenly and with force

UNDERGRADUATES.Definition: students who are studying at a university

NO PUSHOVER.Definition: not an opponent who was easy to defeat

PORCELAIN.Definition: a hard, shiny, white substance used for making pottery

SCHOLARSHIPS.Definition: payments made to support his education which were given to him as a reward

IN DEBT.Definition: unable to pay what he owed

LECTURE.Definition: a formal talk on a serious subject delivered before an audience or class

MONEY-MAKER.Definition: the activity that produced a lot of money

TAKING MUCH OF THE LITERARY WORLD BY STO.Definition: quickly becoming very popular among the people who were involved with written pieces of art

MODEST.Definition: having a humble or moderate opinion about himself

CUSTOMS.Definition: the place at the port where officials check incoming travellers, goods, and etc.

FAME.Definition: the state of being well known and recognised

LILY.Definition: a bell-shaped flower with a long stem

FLOWING.Definition: hanging loosely in an attractive and elegant way

OBSTACLE.Definition: problem, something that would prevent him from moving forward

OUTPUT.Definition: amount of works that he produced

CATAPULTED.Definition: led him suddenly and at a great speed

HE TOOK EXCEPTION TO.Definition: strongly objected to, strongly disagreed with

EMBARRASS.Definition: cause him to feel shame and worry

OLD-FASHIONED.Definition: belonging to a time in the past

LIBEL.Definition: the crime of stating in writing a false statement about someone that can affect their reputation

TO DIG DEEP.Definition: to do a very thorough investigation

TREADMILL.Definition: a wheel with steps on which a person walks, used to power machinery

SET SAIL.Definition: began a voyage, a trip by ship

BANKRUPT.Definition: unable to pay what he owed

DEATHBED.Definition: the bed on which he was dying

EXILED.Definition: living in a foreign country because he couldn't live in his own

LEGACY.Definition: the things he left or handed down after he died

PERSECUTED.Definition: victimised or subjected to bad treatment

PARDON.Definition: the action of releasing a person from punishment

POLYMATH.Definition: having knowledge of a lot of things

IN HIDING.Definition: where he couldn't be seen or found
